conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves backward, away from the objects but still above them.
The image shows four objects above slabs, illuminated by a light source, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Shadow A is cast by a black cup or container.
Shadow B is cast by a green avocado or similar spherical object.
Shadow C is cast by an object that is partially visible in the image.
Shadow D is cast by a waffle or a similar textured square item.
When a light source moves relative to an object, the size and position of the shadow change.

premise: When a light source moves backward, the light rays become more parallel.
conclusion: Shadows become closer in size to the actual objects, generally becoming smaller and more defined.

premise: When a light source moves backward while remaining above the objects, the shadows move closer to being directly beneath their respective objects.
conclusion: The offset of each shadow from its object decreases.

premise: Shadow A is currently offset from the cup and somewhat enlarged.
conclusion: Shadow A will move closer to being directly under the cup and will become smaller.

premise: Shadow B is currently offset from the avocado and somewhat enlarged.
conclusion: Shadow B will move closer to being directly under the avocado and will become smaller.

premise: Shadow C is currently significantly offset, suggesting the light is at an angle.
conclusion: Shadow C will move closer to the object creating it, becoming less offset.

premise: Shadow D is currently offset from the waffle, enlarged with less defined edges.
conclusion: Shadow D will move closer to being directly under the waffle and will become smaller with more defined edges.

premise: When the light source moves backward while remaining above the objects, the shadows become smaller, move closer to being directly beneath their objects, and have more defined edges.
conclusion: The overall spread of shadows across the surface decreases as they concentrate more directly beneath the objects.

premise: When the light source moves backward, the shadows shift forward and become shorter and smaller.
conclusion: A, B, C, and D shift forward, moving beneath the objects, and become shorter and smaller.
